able to destroy harmful microbes (= small living things that can cause disease): antimicrobial drugs Some enzymes found in milk are thought to have natural antimicrobial properties.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is now standard procedure to intravenously administer antimicrobial drugs like amikacin to the wounded.Grapefruit seeds are believed to have antimicrobial properties. Our safety agenda includes healthcare-associated infections and antimicrobial resistance.

a drug or substance that is able to destroy harmful microbes (= small living things that can cause disease): Urethral infections are treated with oral antimicrobials. Plain soap is an antimicrobial.
More examplesFewer examplesThe risk of developing a fungal infection can be limited by the use of antimicrobials.Which antimicrobial would be most appropriate to prescribe for this patient?Triclosan is an antimicrobial that is used in soaps, detergents, toothpaste, deodorants and chopping boards.Approximately 110 million courses of antibiotics and other antimicrobials are prescribed every year.
